data.title: Elizabeth Rose Steiger (1879-1962)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Elizabeth Rose Steiger born 1879 Speyer, Germany died 1962 Fort Wayne, Allen, Indiana, USA including research + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:

[sibling(s) unknown]

[children unknown]

Profile last modified 13 Mar 2017

This page has been accessed 78 times.

Biography

Born 14 MAR 1879. Speyer, Germany. [1]

Buried 01 FEB 1962. Catholic Cemetery, Fort Wayne, Indiana, Sec. D, lane 396.

Event: Mortuary Tom Mungovan.

Religion: St. Andrew's/.

Note: #N149.

Marriage Husband John Baptist Dirig. Wife Elizabeth Rose Steiger. Marriage 11 JUN 1902. Fort Wayne, Allen County, Indiana, USA. [2]

Notes

Note N149The Fort Wayne Journal Gazette, January 30, 1962, page 2. Mrs. Elizabeth R. Dirig, 82, formerly of 1532 Maumee Ave., died at 9 a.m. Monday in a nursing home where she had been a patient three years. Mrs. Dirig was a charter member of St. Andrew's Catholic Church and its Rosary Society. She was born in Speyer, Germany, and came to Fort Wayne when she was four years old. Her husband, John, died in 1950. Surviving are three daughters, Mrs. Mary Vorndran, Mrs. Irene Minnich and Mrs. Sylvia Weber, all of Fort Wayne; six sons, Charles W., Edward J., George J., John A., Albert E., and Norbert A., all of Fort Wayne, 37 grandchildren and 22 great-grandchildren. The body was taken to the Tom Mungovan Funeral Home, where friends may call after 7 p.m today. Services will be there at 9 a.m. Thursday and at 9:30 in St. Andrew's Church. Rev Robert Curley will officiate and burial will be in the Catholic Cemetery. The Rosary Society will meet at the funeral home at 8 p.m. Wednesday.

Sources

↑ Source: #S19 January 30, 1962, page 2. The Fort Wayne Journal Gazette.

↑ Source: #S177 Book 25, page 217. Fort Wayne, Allen County, Indiana.
